definition: Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Waiter, we want fish filets in hot chili oil.
sentences.chinese: 服务员，给我们来个水煮鱼。

sentences.english: Com: Waiter, we want fish filets in hot chili oil.
sentences.chinese: 服务员，给我们来个水煮鱼。

sentences.english: Boiled fish is recommended, a large quantity delicious.
sentences.chinese: 水煮鱼也值得推荐，量大味美。

sentences.english: This is why some people will from time to eat boiled fish's sake.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么有些人会隔三差五吃一顿水煮鱼的缘故。

sentences.english: Simple: It's been half an hour, where is our fish filets in hot chili oil?
sentences.chinese: 都半个小时了，我们的水煮鱼怎么还没上？

sentences.english: Cooking water cook fish oil used not only dosage, and more repeatedly heating.
sentences.chinese: 烹制水煮鱼所用的油不仅用量多，而且反复加热。

sentences.english: I'm a boiled fish, several meat.
sentences.chinese: 我叫了个水煮鱼，几个肉。

definition: duck's blood and beef tripe in spicy soup
pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]
mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce

yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
